long_desc.thetext:
The API Viewer is usually pretty robust with regard to empty elements (e.g. within a class, <methods/> is just fine), but it throws an exception on an empty <constructor/> element.
Since constructors are not strictly necessary in Python, it would be nice to allow for empty <constructor/> elements. Currently, I've programmed around this in XSLT, checking for a __init__ method and adding the <constructor> element only if one is found. If none is found in API Viewer no constructor shows up at all for such a class, which is ok (while with a <constructor><method/></constructor> construct, the constructor is displayed as "undefined", which is also nice).

It is now possible not to define any constructor. In this case the api viewer would display the constructor of the super class. Having an empty constructor is still not possible but I see no reason to have one anyway.
